message.content:
cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.CV. 

The paper proposes a method for evaluating the safety of Automated Vehicles (AVs) using stochastic human-controlled vehicle (HV) motions modeled based on naturalistic driving data. This involves using statistical techniques such as Importance Sampling theory to accurately assess the safety benefits of AVs under accelerated tests. The paper also focuses on the car-following scenario. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is Robotics (cs.RO) as the paper deals with the evaluation of AVs. Other likely sub-categories include Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) as the paper uses statistical techniques to evaluate the safety benefits of AVs, Systems and Control (cs.SY) as the paper deals with the control of AVs, Machine Learning (cs.LG) as the paper uses statistical techniques to evaluate the safety benefits of AVs, and Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) as the paper deals with the modeling of human-controlled vehicle (HV) motions based on naturalistic driving data.
